s1: Massive amounts of data are being collected by public and private organisations, and research projects, while the Internet provides a very large source of information about almost every aspect of human life and society.
s2: Society relies on many complex systems of interacting technology, people, processes, laws and other elements. Examples of such systems include air transport, telecommunications and energy supply.

s1: Analysing such data can provide significant benefits to an organisation.
s2: Because software is a critical component of such systems, Software Engineers will often work in Systems Engineering teams.

s1: This course provides a practical focus on the technology and research in the area of data mining.
s2: Systems Engineering is a holistic, multi-disciplinary and well established approach to the engineering of these complex systems.

s1: It focuses on the algorithms and techniques and less on the mathematical and statistical foundations.
s2: Systems Engineering is a holistic, multi-disciplinary and well established approach to the engineering of these complex systems.

s1: Critically analyse and justify the steps involved in the data mining process.
s2: identify and explain the activities involved in each phase of the Systems Engineering life-cycle.

s1: Anticipate and identify data issues related to data mining.
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Test and apply the principal algorithms and techniques used in data mining.
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Justify suitable techniques to use for a given data mining problem.
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Appraise and reflect upon the results of a data mining project using suitable measurements.
s2: Detailed design and development: Detailed design requirements and design engineering activities; review and feedback, and incorporation of design changes.

s1: Reflect upon ethical and social impacts of data mining.
s2: describe the holistic and multi-disciplinary nature of complex engineering projects.
